content:
• Friday, July 1, 2011
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR) breaks out of a tight two-week trading range today, leaping nearly 10% on heavy...

    Questcor (QCOR) breaks out of a tight two-week trading range today, leaping nearly 10% on heavy volume, and closing at a new 52-week high. The stock is up 120% since February, largely on the performance of its multiple sclerosis drug Acthar.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • MRK

    Merck (MRK +0.6%) gives a lift to drug stocks after winning approval to sell its blockbuster...

    Merck (MRK +0.6%) gives a lift to drug stocks after winning approval to sell its blockbuster cancer vaccine Gardasil in Japan. The approval opens a key sales market for the drug as it nears global saturation. DRG +0.5%, BTK +1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • TSL

    Research firm Solarbuzz believes solar module inventories soared in Q2, due to weak European...

    Research firm Solarbuzz believes solar module inventories soared in Q2, due to weak European demand. With prices coming under pressure, Solarbuzz warns of the industry facing a challenging second half. This could explain why a number of solar names are underperforming today. TSL -5%. CSIQ -0.8%. YGE -2.3%. [[HSOL] -2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRUS

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +6.4%) gains after Needham reiterates its Strong Buy rating and expects...

    Cirrus Logic (CRUS +6.4%) gains after Needham reiterates its Strong Buy rating and expects upward 1Q guidance. "In the two weeks since we last urged investors to revisit CRUS shares at a likely bottom, we have seen the supply chain suggest upward revisions on Apple's (AAPL +2.2%) iPad forecast," says an analyst.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • WLT

    Coal producer Walter Energy (WLT +4.9%) adds to gains following the resignation of its CEO Keith...

    Coal producer Walter Energy (WLT +4.9%) adds to gains following the resignation of its CEO Keith Calder. Calder - who was CEO of Western Coal prior to being purchased by Walter - is leaving after just three months on the job, citing "differences of opinion concerning management philosophy."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM

  • Dr. Copper +4% today, adding more fuel to the positive economic spin emanating after today's...

    Dr. Copper +4% today, adding more fuel to the positive economic spin emanating after today's stronger-than-expected ISM report. Word that China may be holding interest rates steady is helping support prices. Copper futures for September delivery stand at $4.30/pound, up from $4.09 earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • DRI

    Darden (DRI) +5.1%) pops after issuing strong guidance yesterday, expecting to open 80-90 new...

    Darden (DRI) +5.1%) pops after issuing strong guidance yesterday, expecting to open 80-90 new restaurants in 2012. The firm reported strong 4Q sales (+6.8% Y/Y), saying higher prices were offset by lower expenses. Darden's rosy outlook also pushes up competitors: EAT +6.2%, RT +3.6%, PFCB +3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • ISCA

    International Speedway (ISCA +6.3%) is getting a boost from a valuation upgrade at Raymond...

    International Speedway (ISCA +6.3%) is getting a boost from a valuation upgrade at Raymond James. The firm notes NASCAR viewership for the Sprint Cup race series is up, which should translate into higher ticket sales for the 2011 racing season.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • P

    Tech IPO buzz hits fever pitch as LivingSocial's $1B IPO leaks, and Zynga files. Shares of...

    Tech IPO buzz hits fever pitch as LivingSocial's $1B IPO leaks, and Zynga files. Shares of already-public Pandora (P +8.5%) and LinkedIn (LNKD +3.3%) continue to gain, but the bubble tag has been bandied about due to sky-high valuations. Tech IPOs hit $5.9B in 2Q, but still trail the frenzied levels of 1998-2000.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • DGII

    Networking device maker Digi (DGII +7.8%) trades higher after Piper Jaffray initiates with an...

    Networking device maker Digi (DGII +7.8%) trades higher after Piper Jaffray initiates with an outperform, saying it's an overlooked energy efficiency/smart grid play. The shares sell for just 6X 2012 enterprise value, and Piper expects double-digit revenue growth over the next 3 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • DMAN

    DemandTec (DMAN -19%) is getting crushed after Raymond James cuts its price target following a...

    DemandTec (DMAN -19%) is getting crushed after Raymond James cuts its price target following a disappointing Q1 and terrible follow-up guidance from the company. In a note to clients, the analyst says "It was the worst conference call that I have ever listened to."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • AZZ

    AZZ soars over 14% after Q1 earnings rise 49%, with strong sales in its galvanizing-services...

    AZZ soars over 14% after Q1 earnings rise 49%, with strong sales in its galvanizing-services segment offsetting reduced margins from higher material costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +2.4%) goes public with a bang, receiving favorable comments from a slew...

    Marathon Petroleum (MPC +2.4%) goes public with a bang, receiving favorable comments from a slew of analysts. Deutsche calls Marathon Oil's downstream spinoff a Buy as a "premium play" on refining, while RBC, Oppenheimer and Credit Suisse initiate with Outperform ratings. For good measure, the company was also added to the S&P 500.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • APOL

    With the bar set so low, Apollo Group's (APOL +7.1%) better-than-expected quarter and guidance...

    With the bar set so low, Apollo Group's (APOL +7.1%) better-than-expected quarter and guidance pushes shares to the top of the S&P leader board. Apollo's Y/Y enrollments slipped 16%, but investors have priced in the expected decline and are focusing on the potential for better numbers ahead. Goldman, Merrill and FBR raise price targets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • AZZ

    Electrical equipment and components maker AZZ (AZZ +15.2%) trades at a new 52-week high after...

    Electrical equipment and components maker AZZ (AZZ +15.2%) trades at a new 52-week high after its first-quarter EPS of $0.75 beat expectations of $0.63. It raised full-year EPS guidance to $2.90-3.10, vs. $2.91, and declared a $0.25/share dividend.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +2%) adds to yesterday's gains following news of an LED bulb collaboration with GE....

    Cree (CREE +2%) adds to yesterday's gains following news of an LED bulb collaboration with GE. But with LED prices under pressure, many analysts remain negative. Morgan Stanley reiterated an Underweight rating on Wednesday, and today, Canaccord and Gabelli are reiterating Hold and Sell ratings, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +3.8%) rejects a $500M offer from DST Group to invest in Weibo. A hybrid of Twitter...

    Sina (SINA +3.8%) rejects a $500M offer from DST Group to invest in Weibo. A hybrid of Twitter and Facebook, Weibo has become the most popular social media website in China. DST had reportedly appaised the site at around $5B.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • RPXC

    Non-practicing entity firms are benefiting from Google losing out on the Nortel bidding. Called...

    Non-practicing entity firms are benefiting from Google losing out on the Nortel bidding. Called "patent trolls," they're known for buying up existing patents or patent portfolios and then using an army of lawyers to search out companies to sue: Acacia Research (ACTP +4%), RPX (RPXC +2%), Interdigital (IDCC +12%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • XRTX

    Shares of Xyratex (XRTX -9.5%) drop a day after after the firm forecasts Q3 earnings falling...

    Shares of Xyratex (XRTX -9.5%) drop a day after after the firm forecasts Q3 earnings falling below expectations, and says it faces 'a very challenged' environment due to regulatory reviews of industry consolidation that has delayed capital investment. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • CBK

    Christopher & Banks (CBK +12.9%) soars a day after beating Q1 estimates on lower sales, but...

    Christopher & Banks (CBK +12.9%) soars a day after beating Q1 estimates on lower sales, but a $43M unexpected profit. Sterne Agee maintains a Neutral rating, and a $7 price target on the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (JASO -2.9%) opens lower after acquiring Silver Age Holdings in a stock deal valued at...

    JA Solar (JASO -2.9%) opens lower after acquiring Silver Age Holdings in a stock deal valued at close to $180M. The purchase adds important technology, and will boost production of wafers for its solar cells, the company says. (PR).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • KBH

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH) +3.2% premarket after taking the unusual step of issuing a statement to...

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH) +3.2% premarket after taking the unusual step of issuing a statement to reassure investors of its comfortable cash position. While KBH “will continue to evaluate its future cash requirements and financing opportunities available in the capital markets, there is no plan to issue equity,” it promises. Shares sank 18% since issuing Q2 earnings on Wednesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • TIVO

    TIVO may be a prime candidate for a takeover once it settles a 7-year patent dispute with DISH....

    TIVO may be a prime candidate for a takeover once it settles a 7-year patent dispute with DISH. Possible suitors could be Google, Microsoft, or ROVI. According to Maxim, the company could be worth $20/share, almost double its current price. Shares +3.9% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • ACUR

    Acura Pharma (OTC:ACUR) +9% premarket after receiving a $20M milestone payment from Pfizer...

    Acura Pharma (OTC:ACUR) +9% premarket after receiving a $20M milestone payment from Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) triggered by the FDA's approval of its application for OXECTA tablets, which use Acura's anti-tampering technology. (PR) Alex Shadunsky nailed this one.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • GIS

    Argus downgrades General Mills (NYSE:GIS) to Hold on weak guidance driven by slow sales and...

    Argus downgrades General Mills (NYSE:GIS) to Hold on weak guidance driven by slow sales and higher raw material costs. In its recent earnings report, the company estimates 2012 adjusted earnings to be around $2.60 to $2.62 a share, slightly below $2.68 consensus. Shares -1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) +15% premarket on Nortel's successful $4.5B auction of its patents,...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) +15% premarket on Nortel's successful $4.5B auction of its patents, suggesting IDCC may be undervalued.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • IDCC

    Premarket gainers: IDCC +15%. OTC:ACUR +9%. CTIC +6%. APOL +5%. TIVO +4%. DNDN +4%. LYG +3%. KBH...

    Premarket gainers: IDCC +15%. OTC:ACUR +9%. CTIC +6%. APOL +5%. TIVO +4%. DNDN +4%. LYG +3%. KBH +3%.
    Losers: CVC -28%. EK -13%. WFR -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • KODK

    Eastman Kodak (EK) -14.5% premarket after the ITC's mixed ruling on the company’s patent...

    Eastman Kodak (EK) -14.5% premarket after the ITC's mixed ruling on the company’s patent dispute with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Research in Motion (RIMM). But Kodak claims the ruling was "favorable," with an extension of the target date for a final ruling until Aug. 30. “We are gratified that the Commission has decided to modify in our favor the judge’s initial recommendation," Kodak says.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • BBBB

    Educational software developer Blackboard (NASDAQ:BBBB) agrees to be acquired for $45/share...

    Educational software developer Blackboard (NASDAQ:BBBB) agrees to be acquired for $45/share ($1.64B plus $130M in debt) by Providence Equity Partners, a 21% premium to when Blackboard said it was exploring a sale on April 18. Shares closed Thursday -0.6% to $43.39, but surged 12.8% AH to $48.93 on speculation of a deal. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC Electronic Materials (WFR) terminates its long-term deal with Suntech Power Holdings...

    MEMC Electronic Materials (WFR) terminates its long-term deal with Suntech Power Holdings (NYSE:STP), which had WFR supplying STP with solar wafers over a 10-year period. Since the downturn in early 2009, volume and price issues have created challenges to finding a mutually beneficial arrangement. WFR -1.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM
  • RBS

    RBS (RBS +2.65%) has reportedly reached a deal to sell a 25% stake in a group of U.K....

    RBS (RBS +2.65%) has reportedly reached a deal to sell a 25% stake in a group of U.K. commercial-property loans to Blackstone (NYSE:BX). With a face value of £1.4B ($2.2B), a deal would be the largest such disposal of U.K. commercial-property debt. (see also)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:13 AM
